results.title: Analysis of a television commercial
results.creator_credit: Eric Halliday, AFTRS and Vass Contis
results.brief_description: Eric Halliday interviews Bruce Kerridge, producer of the Mining Industry Council commercials and Dr. Ian Mills, a La Trobe University lecturer who indicate reasons for the production of a commercial and a method for interpreting the same.

results.title: Analysis by mass: an introduction to the mass spectrometer
results.creator_credit: Michael Clarke, Associated Electrical Industries Film Unit and Brian Kaufman
results.brief_description: Structure of atom and nucleus; definition of isotopes; principle of the mass spectograph, explained by a model in which balls of different masses are deflected by different amounts in a constant magnetic field. Construction of a mass spectrometer. Uses of mass spectrometry: to identify molecules, determine molecular structure, measure impurities, analyse gases in breath, radioactive dating of rocks.

results.title: Analysing interaction No.1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Nell Smith, Open University and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
Shows an interaction sequence between a young man (Russ) and an older woman (Angela) who meet at a party. This sequence is then analysed by seven different psychologists and sociologists who adapt different orientations. Three of the analyses are presented in the first part. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary School level.

results.title: Analysing characters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Literature Appreciation”.
Literary characters of James Thurber, Bret Hart and Nathaniel Hawthorne some to life to explain themselves, and appear in dramatisations of famous stories. They rate themselves in terms of development and complexity, and invite judgement of their actions based on each author’s purpose in writing their story.

results.title: Ana: an interpreter
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Debby Kingsland and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Ana is a Spanish/English interpreter in a Sydney family centre. The film shows some of the problems with which she works - human rather than linguistic ones - and her relationships with English-speaking co-workers. The film is designed to raise questions about the need for communicators like Ana and about the isolation of non-English speaking people.

results.title: An Untitled film
results.brief_description: Beautifully photographed black and white film in slow motion of life on a farm - dogs, cats, chickens, horses, a man shovelling and burning grass, and a boy watching a chicken being strangled. These strong images are accompanied by experimental music that compliments this well shot film.

results.title: An Unremarkable birth
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Kathleen Shannon and Diane Beaudry
results.brief_description: A growing number of parents are concerned about the impersonal approach to childbirth seen in many hospitals. They find hospital procedures inflexible and more often geared to the needs of the institution than to those of child and parent. Members of the medical profession and parents discuss today’s obstetric methods and alternatives to them. The film candidly records the birth of a baby and the interaction of mother and father.

results.title: An unnecessary famine
results.creator_credit: Chris Bryer, Yorkshire Television, Peter Gordon and Ian McFarlane
results.brief_description: Using Sudan as an example, shows that the causes of hunger in developing nations are both natural and political. Considers the roles of the World Bank and the major economic powers in this situation

results.title: An Unexpected party
results.creator_credit: Michael Bond, Ivor Wood and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”
When word arrives that Paddington’s Aunt Lucy is celebrating her one-hundredth birthday, the Browns offer to send Paddington home to Lima to visit for the occasion. The Browns are afraid he will leave forever, but he assures them that he will return. Adapted from Chapter 7 from the book Paddington Marches On by Michael Bond. Narrated by Michael Hordern.
